definition: to open and close (the mouth etc)
to open and close (the mouth etc)/friendly/compliant/Taiwan pr. [xi4]
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: ' said Fleur, her nostrils flaring. 'What do I care how 'e looks?
sentences.chinese: 芙蓉说，鼻孔翕动着，“我干嘛在乎他长得怎么样？

sentences.english: Ralph's lips formed a word but no sound came.
sentences.chinese: 拉尔夫嘴唇在翕动，但没有声音出来。

sentences.english: He kept moving his lips but could not utter a word.
sentences.chinese: 他的嘴唇翕动着，可已经说不出话来。

sentences.english: Its wings are weak in flight. Afraid to be unknown, All night it gleams alone.
sentences.chinese: 萤火轻飞翔，翅膀翕动忙，唯恐人不知，整夜闪微光。

sentences.english: The prisoner's swollen mouth widened in a grin;
sentences.chinese: 囚徒红肿的嘴唇翕动了一下，露齿一笑。

definition: variant of 翕動|翕动[xi1 dong4]
to stir/to lift/to set sth in motion
to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
to shake (a part of one's body)/to shrug (shoulders)/to create a sensation/to incite
